years.title: How it all started
years.description: My coding journey began in 2017 by watching a course on Udemy. This course covered the overall basics of HTML, CSS and JavaScript, but gave far from a good foundation. I quickly started my self-taugh journey after this course, where Stackoverflow was my best friend.

years.title: Things become REACTive
years.description: Finally, after a long time, I picked up React, which entirely changed my view on web development. Since I discovered and tested React myself, I've used it for pretty much every project of mine.

years.title: Data consumption
years.description: After quite some time, I decided frontend wasn't good enough. Therefore, I explored other options like Python and Node.js. My personal favorite for websites and APIs is Node.js (it's pretty much JavaScript), but I also know Python well.

years.title: Things get pretty
years.description: This is when I started thinking, "Maybe programming is something I want to do for a living". Therefore, I put effort into designs and also made code as optimized as possible. Here are some examples (within the last month).
